metadata.name: Message
metadata.description:
Message

Represents a Pub/Sub Message.

Message objects are created by {Topic#publish}. {Subscription#pull} returns an array of {ReceivedMessage} objects, each of which contains a Message object. Each {ReceivedMessage} object can be acknowledged and/or delayed.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

# Publish a message
topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
message = topic.publish "new-message"
puts message.data #=>  "new-message"

# Pull a message
sub = pubsub.subscription "my-topic-sub"
received_message = sub.pull.first
puts received_message.message.data #=>  "new-message"

metadata.name: initialize
metadata.description: Create an empty Message object. This can be used to publish several messages in bulk.

metadata.name: message_id
metadata.description: The ID of this message, assigned by the server at publication time. Guaranteed to be unique within the topic.
